SEARCH
Module com.example.romeandvikings
Package com.example.romeandvikings.model

Class Map

java.lang.Object
com.example.romeandvikings.model.Map
public class Map extends Object
The Map class represents a map with cities and routes, and provides methods to add cities and routes to the map.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Map(Implementation implementationEnum)
    This is a constructor for the `Map` class.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    addCities()
    The function "addCities" adds cities to a map and creates radio buttons for each city.
    void
    addRoutes()
    The function "addRoutes" adds routes between cities in a graph, creates lines to represent the routes on a GUI, and assigns tooltips to the lines with the difficulty of each route.
    IGraph<Integer,City>
    getGraph()
    The function returns a graph containing integer vertices and City objects as the data for each vertex.
    HashMap<Integer,javafx.scene.shape.Line>
    getLines()
    The function returns a HashMap containing Line objects, with Integer keys.
    HashMap<Integer,javafx.scene.control.RadioButton>
    getRadioButtons()
    The function returns a HashMap containing Integer keys and RadioButton values.

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • Map

      public Map(Implementation implementationEnum) throws exceptionNoVertexExist, exceptionOnGraphTypeNotAllowed
      This is a constructor for the `Map` class. It takes an `Implementation` enum as a parameter and initializes the `map` variable based on the enum value. If the enum value is `ADJACENCY_LIST`, it creates a new `GraphAdjacentList` object with `GraphType.SIMPLE`. Otherwise, it creates a new `GraphAdjacentMatrix` object with a size of 50 and `GraphType.SIMPLE`.
      Throws:
      exceptionNoVertexExist
      exceptionOnGraphTypeNotAllowed

  • Method Details

    • addCities

      public void addCities() throws exceptionNoVertexExist
      The function "addCities" adds cities to a map and creates radio buttons for each city.
      Throws:
      exceptionNoVertexExist

    • addRoutes

      public void addRoutes() throws exceptionNoVertexExist, exceptionOnGraphTypeNotAllowed
      The function "addRoutes" adds routes between cities in a graph, creates lines to represent the routes on a GUI, and assigns tooltips to the lines with the difficulty of each route.
      Throws:
      exceptionNoVertexExist
      exceptionOnGraphTypeNotAllowed

    • getGraph

      public IGraph<Integer,City> getGraph()
      The function returns a graph containing integer vertices and City objects as the data for each vertex.
      Returns:
      The method is returning an IGraph object, which is a graph data structure.
